items.headline: Precious metals are going to party like it’s the 1970s, reckons Albert Edwards
items.summary_en: “Is gold’s 60% rally this year merely the appetizer for a late-1970s-style main course?” asks Edwards

items.headline: Why 2025 has been such a historic year for oil — with prices set to finish near a 5-year low
items.summary_en: The world has more oil than it needs, but a drop in crude prices this week to the lowest level in nearly five years may help slow production and boost demand.
items.next_en: Next: watch scheduled data (CPI/Jobs/Fed) or company guidance.

items.headline: Loss-making Chinese AI chipmaker founded by ex-AMD employees surges eightfold in debut
items.summary_en: At 50 times price to sales, MetaX looks expensive but investor demand focused on China’s determination to build national champions in the tech sector
items.next_en: Next: watch scheduled data (CPI/Jobs/Fed) or company guidance.

items.headline: ‘We all have economic jitters’: After the Fed cut rates, should my son buy a $600K house?
items.summary_en: “They are tuned in to friends and colleagues, who are losing jobs, cognizant of shifts in company agendas and financial worries.”
items.next_en: Next: watch scheduled data (CPI/Jobs/Fed) or company guidance.

items.headline: ‘Am I simply the unloved son?’ My mother ghosted me after my father died. Is she stealing his money?
items.summary_en: “No phone calls, no holiday cards, no explanation, no anything.”
items.next_en: Next: watch scheduled data (CPI/Jobs/Fed) or company guidance.

items.headline: ‘It’s heartbreaking’: My cousin died and her estranged husband has taken possession of her home. Can we evict him?
items.summary_en: “The house remains in her name. He has since kicked out each of the boys one by one.”
items.next_en: Next: watch scheduled data (CPI/Jobs/Fed) or company guidance.

items.headline: Mila Kunis jokes about her thankless role as head of her homeowners association—it’s ‘complaints, all day long’
items.summary_en: Actress Mila Kunis is used to her work being met with applause—but the only thing she’s getting in her role as the head of her local homeowners association is complaints.

items.headline: My 401(k) plan is emailing me about annuities, but I’m only in my 50s. Is this something I should do?
items.summary_en: Options will keep coming, but signing up for an annuity is something you want to carefully consider

items.headline: Energy stocks are the new bonds, this strategist argues

items.headline: ‘He never asks for anything’: I’m 61 with a $1.5 million 401(k). My girlfriend says I do too much for my son, 28. Is she right?
items.summary_en: “I recently gave him $20,000 for a newer car and had him finance the rest.”
